Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: LeTourer
Reviews.Content: Our family of four and a couple had booked and pre-paid for a two night stay several months before we arrived. Travelling from Australia with six people meant we had to know we had a bed before we got to Amsterdam. What a nightmare to discover it was a dump. We're not fussy but this place stinks of cigarette, rude owner, rooms are poky, bugs on pillows, toilet leaked. Shown to a different room which was no better. We went out for a meal thinking it might look better after a few drinks. It didn't. We piled into our hired van and found friendly staff and clean rooms out near the airport. Steer clear of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money. Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: lisaboodoo
Reviews.Content: Obviously this is not a 5star hotel but as far as this website is concerned it gets 5 stars from me. Went with 8 girls for 30th birthday for the weekend17-19th Feb. Price Â£34 ppn. We all stayed in ensuite double rooms. They were compact but simple and clean. For all the time we spent there, it suited our purposes perfectly. In a nutshell.... Friendly staff, Clean rooms, good location, good price. Would recommend if u are looking for cheap accommodation in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Awful staff, disgusting room. Ruined out trip to Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: christine c
Reviews.Content: The experience in your hotel ruined our trip to Amsterdam. I'm not picky, we didn't expect a 4 star hotel, but we did expect somewhere that was at least clean! I wouldn't let my worst enemy spend the night here. We booked hotel Barbacan in February thinking we would be staying in a basic, clean hotel with a double bed and a bathroom. Instead, upon our arrival we were sent to a twin room with a communal bathroom, the ceiling had a 3 foot stretch of mold which leaked, we told reception about it, they said no refunds and no room changes, we asked to speak to a manager, she said they were off for the weekend, we found it hard to get a receipt for proof of stay, but secured one on check out. The staff showed absolutely no interest in our complaints, and were rude and unfriendly. The fact that the staff seemed to show no interest in our complaints and that we were stuck with a moldy room are, to me, completely unacceptable. The bathroom was very very unclean, we had asked for a room with a bathroom and double bed but we got a communal bathroom!! we couldnt even walk around in it it was so small, and people kept trying to walk in when I was in there. we had to sleep with the window opened when staying there as we didnâ€™t want to breathe mold in (it wasn't warm and in fact rained), we were tempted to take on extra cost to change hotels, but because the woman at the desk refused to hand me back the money I had given her prior to seeing the disgraceful room, we couldn't change our accommodation. There were other hotels in the area we could have gone to, but because we had given her the money we were unable to go anywhere. We felt we were forced to stay in your hotel. IT completely ruined our trip, I can't describe how horrible the hotel rooms were, the staff were them most ignorant people.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Sen2012
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with this hotel online through booking.com on 11th January 2012. While â€Ždoing that, I made a mistake, instead of booking myself on 19 I booked myself on 12th â€ŽJan. 2012. After 7 minutes, I realized I made a mistake because the booking.com â€Žwebpage is tricky. I called booking.com and they said they explained the matter to the â€Žhotel and that the hotel will come back to me in one hour. Got no reply, so called the â€Žhotel and there I got the shock of my life. there Front Office Manager named, Nelly, was â€Žso rude that I can not even believe my ears. First she said the HOTEL POLICY says I can â€Žnot cancel. I said I don't want to cancel, just only change the check in date. Called â€Žbooking.com again and tried to talk to a supervisor there called Luis Juarev. He also tried â€Žto talk to her, but he came back to me with nothing. I called the hotel again and Nelly â€Žpicked up the phone again. She told me literally, "you made the wrong booking and we â€Žare going to take your money and we don't even care if you come or don't come, as long â€Žas we get our money." and hang up the phone on my face. That was truly the most â€Žterrible experience I had with hotels in my life, and it happened in Amsterdam. Now I â€Žfeel like I was mugged. â€Ž Guys, anyone here has the contact address of the authority in charge of hotels in â€ŽAmsterdam? I would be grateful. Please send it to my e-mail: soori2004@yahoo.com. â€Ž Thank you for reading this.â€Ž Regards, â€Ž H. S.â€Ž

Reviews.Title: “Simple basic rooms without fuss at a good location (with a bicycle!)”
Reviews.Author: emelyn_alex
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about the Hotel in general as the room and shared bathroom were clean and comfortable. The TV was functioning, there was sink in the room with a small window to let some fresh air in. Narrow staircase leading up to the rooms so those with bigger bags do be careful. Finding a cheap hotel in Amsterdam is not easy let alone on a last minute trip so we were grateful that we managed to get our room at Hotel Barbacan. Although the Hotel is not in the city centre per se, this is easily overcome with renting a bicycle. All the attractions were therefore easily accessible and I would suggest that the best way to explore Amsterdam is to do it by bicycle. There is the flea market close by with very reasonably /cheap priced items -Waterlooplein. To the party animals who intend to stay in Barbacan Hotel, make sure you have dinner before going back to the Hotel as there no shops open for this. In the morning there is a lovely bakery nearby selling really good sandwiches and a coffee shop ( as in real coffee :) ) with good coffee. Overall it was a pleasant experience and we would definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful budget hotel great for young travellers.”
Reviews.Author: bunny1983Cleethorpes
Reviews.Content: Me & my friends are in our late 20s & stayed at Hotel Barbacan as part of our European road trip. We found that the hotel offered great value for money, a friendly atmosphere & great location for walking into Amsterdam city centre (about 15 min walk). We had a 5 bed room with a small but perfectly usable bathroom, tv & comfy beds. It was a nice room although if you are looking for luxury, this isn't the place for you. However, if you are looking for a cheap, convenient hotel to use as a base for exploring Amsterdam from then this hotel is ideal. I wouldn't recommend this to families with young children though as more suited to travellers or young people. Overall a great hotel with a cool bar & cheap rooms - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Never going back again + Wish I could bash the receptionist's head in”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Crnat
Reviews.Content: First of all, the room was horrible. The walls weren't even properly painted and outside the window was a great view of maybe 5-year-old cigarette butts. The receptionist was an uptight a-hole and had no trouble telling us that he's not supposed to respect us because we're the guests (?!?!?!) and that after calling my girlfriend stupid, because she said she didn't know it was a family hotel. FAMILY?!?!?! IT WAS FULL OF STONERS and all the time someone was smoking a joint outside...so that's a family hotel?! And you know what? To top it off, he blocked our keycards to our rooms...I guess he wanted to teach us a lesson in his pea-sized, confused and schizophrenic brain of his but as soon as I mentioned the police and stormed out of the hotel, he came back all friendly with 3 new cards. NEVER GO TO HOTEL BARBACAN!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: maxmarbles
Reviews.Content: Could do better if I converted my front room. This place is a death trap. None of the electrics worked, the room was damp and musty and only one window opened as the handles had been removed. The whole place smelt of the large dog which was behind the counter downstairs. If all the park benches are full and you are looking for somewhere to get your head down then consider this Place otherwise avoid and find somewhere better to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_secrets
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 18/05 - 20/05/2011. We had a double room which had 1 x double bed and 2 x single beds which were comfy. Was spacious and cleaned daily. You get a sink in the room and the shared bathroom was on our floor (the top floor, there are around 5 floors so lots of stairs to walk up if your on the top!). The bathroom had a walk in shower and was old but kept very clean. The only downside was we were smoking in our room (we know we should'nt have!) and the night receptionist took â‚¬50.00 from us because of this so if your wanting to smoke in the room I would be very careful or go elsewhere. The Lady receptionist was very nice and gives you lots of maps and info on Trams, buses, excursions etc. The city was beautiful the Hotel is about a 15 mins walk to the centre and a 5 mins walk to a really nice market. Was a nice area. Watch out for the bikes!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst”
Reviews.Author: Stodds73
Reviews.Content: The only reason why we stayed here was because of the price and we quickly regretted it. Amsterdam can be a it expensive so we thought we would opt out of our 90 euro a night hotel and stay at this one for 50 euros, we thought "it's only one night...." We ended up riding our bikes most of the night so we didn't have to go back to the hotel. The reception was really nice compared to the rooms and bathroom. Our room smelt funny and there were stains on the ceiling, sheets and towels. Not clean at all. The bathroom was tiny and not the cleanest. The reception said it opened at 6:30 and we had to catch a train in the morning. We waited to check out but no one came so we just had to slip the key under the door. The only somewhat good thing was it's location. It was close to everything via bike. overall we would not stay here again if you were to pay us....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: robert_424354
Reviews.Content: Don't go to this hotel. Terrible service and useless. I did book my rooms on line and then they cancel without even telling me. When I called them, they didn't want to tell the reason of the cancellation!

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamdamy1
Reviews.Content: stayed with my girlfriend for 4 days. bad reviews made us cautious, dont be. clean and tidy little room, amazing value for money (our deal was about 21 euros each per night) in a fantastic location (10 mins from town centre) with very helpful and friendly staff. room has a sink, bed, cupboard etc all you would ever need to feel comfortable in a place to sleep. as budget hotels go, it doesnt get much better. bad points are that its a little noisy if you have loud neighbouring guests, the walls are a little thin, and only one shared bathroom per floor - however its kept clean and tidy. great place, recommended for singles, couples, groups of up to 4.

Reviews.Title: “I would not let my dog spend a night here”
Reviews.Author: Cmb1978
Reviews.Content: This has to rate as the worst hotel I have evr stayed in, the rooms were filthy, cramped and cold the windows didn't close properly, the curtains were pretty much see through and there was a big neon sign outside, staff were rude, this place is a disgrace, avoid at all costs

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever go here”
Reviews.Author: Jas83
Reviews.Content: Came here on a trip to Amsterdam was staying with a friend and booked a twin room. They put us in a double and said there were no other rooms available we therefore asked for our money back and said we would find another hotel and they refused to give it to us. They said they didn't have a manager and we were unable to leave because they had taken payment from us and refused to give it back despite putting us in a room we did not book. There was no shower holder and random animals in the hotel. The staff were rude and hostile and not at all helpful. There is also no lift. HORRIBLE DON'T EVER GO HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Stay as far away as possible from this establishment.”
Reviews.Author: AnySadegs
Reviews.Content: Our room looked and felt like an old bathhouse, it was dark and kinda damp, it also had a strong smell of chlorine. When we asked about the internet connection that their homepage promised us we we're told that it had not been available for "some time" and that they had no clue when it was coming back up. We immediatly paid the cancellation fee and went to another hotel. Cant see why anyone in their right mind would stay at Barbacan, it wasnt even that cheap. /Johan

Reviews.Title: “please please dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: trelly49
Reviews.Content: what a rip off hostel sorry hotel,booked singles ended up sharing doubles staff very rude and allways looking to scam money from u plus its shed loads of miles from anywhere DONT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: entourage12
Reviews.Content: The hotel Barbacan was horrendous. It was the price of an expensive hotel (150euros/night) but with the accommodations of a bad hostel. First of all, there was no warning that we had to pay in cash up front! Secondly, they have a cat roaming the hotel, which was also not mentioned on the website. The room was disgusting. IT had obviously not been well kept. The floor board leading to the bathroom was not actually connected to the floor. The sliding door to the bathroom was hanging on to the ceiling by a thread. THere were hairs in our bedding. The cleaning service did not show up for three of the four days we were there. They also left only one towel each time for four people. The front desk service could not have been more unwelcoming. After traveling europe for four months, I can sincerely say it was the worst hotel at the worst price I have stayed in. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a Stag do, 5 in one room 6 in another”
Reviews.Author: storming
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a stag party of reasonable guys not crazy stupid blokes but respectable guys aging from 22 to 49 years old on the 26 March 2010 to the 28 March 2010. After reading the horror stories of this hotel on here after already booking hotel for my stag do I have to say it is a 2 & 1/2 star hotel and the think the seriously negative reviews are a unfair. The 6 bedroom room with on suite was more like a normal/large room with 6 beds in it, clean tidy no mould as some have stated as in other rooms, these rooms cost us around Â£25 per night per person you can't really complain I have stayed at hotel that cost more and were far worse. Beds are super soft sit and sink in them ok to sleep in no complaints. there is a hairdryer in the 6 & 5 bedroom rooms and also safes in each however we did not use these. also shower toilet and sink in each of the 5 & 6 bedrooms rooms. the 5 person bedroom again slightly smaller with 5 beds packed in not as newly decorated as the 6 room but still clean tidy no mould or real problems small fist size hole in wall on left as you walk in the door but apart from this nothing to be really worried about. Both rooms were located on the 1st floor As we only stayed in the rooms for 5 and 6 people I can not comment on the 2 bedroom rooms or others. Very quite clean and no complaints about hotel in general. You get for what you pay for and it's a 2 to a 2 1/2 hotel if you want a romantic beautiful hotel then you will have to pay for it, if you want a room to crash in and then go enjoy Amsterdam then this is fine. Checkin painless as to effort fill out a quick form. Guy was a bit of a miserable sod but no big deal as it was late so may have been a off day for him. However like others have said the 'credit card machine' does not work which means you have to pay euros for the rooms as soon as you check in which was really annoying as there was nine of us, all who only bought enough euros for the drinking and eating side of the trip and the room was expected to be paid via credit card so as to be paid off back in the UK, this resulted in us all having to find a cash machine (which is located on the corner need a cafe) and withdraw more euros for the trip resulting in cash machine charges for all. didn't do breakfast as loads of cafes and things on the sort 10/15 minute walk to the main town centre/red light district (or 7 minute walk to a supermarket next to a chinese which has loads of food). it's a 20 minute walk max to station which isn't bad at all. Don't think by my review that this hotel has lots of stag do people or large groups as on our stay we did not see anything that gave us this impression. Would I stay there again? Yes when we go back with the boys to return to Amsterdam on a boys holiday, would I stay there with my girlfriend? If the rooms are like the 5 & 6 bedroom rooms as in of decoration and on a tight budget yes, however if romancing then I would look elsewhere, however this is my opinion only. I think the reviews as WORSE HOTEL EVER are unfair and not a true reflection of my experience of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel on the planet!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mikeu
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend spend % nights in Amsterdam in December. We originaly booked this hotel through the internet and I must say that their presentation in there gave us the impression that it is a basic but decent hotel to stay. The hotel was horrible inside and outside. The lady at reception was very unfriendly and her cat was walking on the reception desk. We had the same problem as other stated before with the payment. We had to pay as soon as we arrived because the payment with the credit card hadn't gone through as the machine is broken. So we payed the money and got the keys to the room. NO lift + 3rd floor + very very narrow stairs + 2 big suitcases = BIG problem!!! Anyway I managed. The room was very small and dirty. The bathroom was 2 square inches. We went downstairs handed the keys and I told the lady that we are not staying in this trogle and left. I didn't care about the money (once you have booked there is no way according to the law to get your money back if you cancel on the day of arrival) I just wanted to get out of there. We picked ourselves another hotel for about the same money and it was really nice. DO NEVER GO THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It only got worse”
Reviews.Author: Bellmoon646
Reviews.Content: On the outside the hotel looks very nice, but once you enter inside everything changes, the condition is old and deteriorating, nothing like the photos advertised. We had requested a double room with a crib option which was not provided. The room they gave us had a broken window which they said they would call a repairman for and it was never fixed during our 4 night stay. The last night topped it off when we heard the scurrying of little rodent feet and checked out immediately and headed to the airport. The shame was that we paid upfront for this room.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: adritata123
Reviews.Content: DO NOT GO THERE!! They consider themselves a Hotel but in reality its a HOSTAL. As everybody else has mentioned Paying cash up front was their scheme. I was expected to be charged by my credit card since i booked it online. They lie saying the credit card machine broke that moment.The night Portier was very rude to us. He lie saying it was prohibited to park in the streets & tried to sell us a parking info for cars but was not needed. He said the room was only 2 floors up but in reality it was the 4th floor in the roof with no elevator!. The free internet service was also a scheme, it was â‚¬2.50 for 30min and service was not working!.The room was full of mold growth in the wall.No heating for the cold temperatures We did not sleep all night since u can hear every other neighbor and their coughing for this very reason, including my boyfriend who also got sick. Shared Facilities. We left the next morning to a very nice Hotel for the same price with our own Bathroom, towels and hairdryer!

Reviews.Title: “Barbacan, never again!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller875
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid our experience in this "hotel" wasn't as we expected. We were 6 people who had booked a six-bed room for two nights during the weekend. We booked it more than two weeks in advance and through their website and we received a confirmation e-mail. The day before we arrived, in the evening, the hotel staff called me and told me that there had been a problem with the authorisation of my credit card and that we could only stay for the first night. When we arrived the only solution, the man at the desk gave us was to split into several rooms and pay 45 euros/person/night instead of 30 euros, which was what we had arranged. He was quite rude and he didn't care at all about us. We paid cash for that night and looked for another place to stay. The 7-bed room we got (although we were just 6 people) has little to do with the pictures, at least it's not as nice and clean. We were on the ground floor, so people walking in the street could see you. The carpet was very ugly and there was a large space between the door and the floor, so any mouse or cockroach could easily enter at any time, and my bed was just beside. The light was very dim and the bathroom was ridiculously small, perhaps just 1 metre wide. The place where breakfast is served is also very small, although the meal was OK. Then, according to their rules, if the fire alarm rings you'll have to pay a 500 euro fine! Our main complain about this hotel is obviously that they cannot change all your plans some hours before you arrive and not care at all. They definitely wanted us to pay more, or assigned our booked second night to other people for a higher price. Whatever it was, that's not the way you should treat your customers!!!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING HOTEL, DISGUSTING PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: hotellover222
Reviews.Content: Not only were we overcharged, doublecharged, and our entire trip ruined because of this hideous people, the hotel itself was dirty and not worth the money. BEWARE AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Uh, how are they permitted to be in business?”
Reviews.Author: travelinfull
Reviews.Content: Okay, so wait, let me be clear. There are apparently a block of rooms that have been sort of remodeled. The building is old...very old. The location in an alleyway was a tad of a turn off, especially with all the bits of trash, and the dead plants in the planter on either side of the door leading into the building. There is no lift, not a biggie, not uncommon in Europe. So it is in fact a very steep and narrow staircase to climb with luggage, but if you know it ahead of time, is it really that big of a deal? The rooms on the SECOND floor are clean, esentially...slightly smelled dusty/musty, the ceiling had water damage and was the sort of ceiling you find in very old schools, like has some asbestos in there. :) Anyway, it's tiny...very tiny. You will get in each other's way, but if you're on vacation, I can hardly imagine that you would be spending any significant amount of time in your room anyway, and if you are...find a resort, don't go to Europe. Let's say that maidservice here is less than just okay. It's very inadequate. Well, we requested a room with two beds, we were given a room with one double bed that could not be separated. They proceed to move us downstairs to another room on the ground level. RUN NOW if they offer you this room. As this is the actual room I'm here to review. It is dark, DIRTY, VERY dirty, the attached pictures should provide adequate explanation. It's like being in a dungeon and everything is scuffed, dingy, peeling, cracking, molding, dusty, etc. Can I just tell you I felt like I was a prisoner trying to hide in this room? The window, looked out well, it didn't...it's blocked by a tangled mess of brambles, and what you could see is that other peoples home entrances on the other side of the street led up from this back area, and also used the area to store trash or something. The front desk is nice enough, but beware of using the blow dryer...you have one hour to use it from the time of pick up or they will charge you a penalty for the dryer. No, not joking. Also, they DO NOT accept credit here AT ALL. Just a warning. We had prepaid so no biggie. The breakfast is your standard continental, not all that fresh, not really worth writing about, so we'll move on. A tram stop is, however, close enough in proximity. Leidseplein is technically within walking distance, it really isn't that far. So...as I said, I'll let my photos speak for themsevles.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back”
Reviews.Author: BritBronco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in July 2008 while on a (quiet) stag do, as we were attracted by the low price for the 6 person room. Hotels in Amsterdam are not cheap, but this appeared to be quite reasonable. First of all finding the hotel was easy enough, although we do know Amsterdam quite well. Although the hotel is slightly away from the main tourist areas it is well connected by trams for both Dam and Liedesplein and it is a reasonable walk back from Dam after the trams stop. Unfortunately price and location are about the only things this hotel has going for it. The 6 person room was occupied about 90% by the beds, there was very little room to move apart from this (perhaps it would benefit from bunkbeds) and the bathroom was tiny. There was no air con in the room, so having 6 people in the room soon made it extremely hot. The Stag refused to have the window open at night which made it too hot to sleep, and once we finally got him to open the window we were woken up at 6am due to the construction work across the street!! Breakfast wasn't a great experience, but it was no different from any other breakfast I have had in an Amsterdam hotel. If I had been staying in a two person room, and perhaps in the winter, then the experience may have been more pleasant, but next time I will be sticking with the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: dbolger1983
Reviews.Content: This was probably the worst hotel experience I have ever had. When we checked in at the hotel, the wall behind the receptionist was filled with printed banners. These were the sort of poster you might imagine hanging in a woman's kitchen; "behind every great man is a better woman", "to err is human, to really mess things up takes a man" etc. You might take these as light hearted jokes, and normally so would I, but the entire wall was taken up with these banners, floor to ceiling. Every single one of them made a derogatory or insulting statement about men. Not wanting to cause a scene, I didn't mention it to the woman who was at the desk when we arrived. I wanted to take a photo so I could show people how bizarre it was, but could not do so discretely or I would add it here. The room (number 11) was unbelievably tiny. It reminded my girlfriend and I more of a prison cell than a hotel. The wallpaper was pealing, and the view out the window was of a disused, littered courtyard. Because the room was stuffy when we arrived, the first thing I did was open one of the double-door-windows. As soon as it was unlocked, the entire door fell off its hinges, and I spent fifteen minutes getting it back on. Next, I checked out the en suite, which was also in a poor state of repair. It was so small you could not disrobe (for a shower or to use the toilet) without the door open. These problems alone would have placed this hotel as the worst I had ever stayed in, there were more issues. When we returned to the hotel after our first day in the city, we found out that the light switch in the room did not work, and had to rely on a sidelamp to illuminate the entire room. We also found getting to sleep very difficult because of noise coming from other buildings through the courtyard outside. At some stage that night, we scuffed one of the sheets on the bed. I'm not sure how it happened, but it looked like a black streak caused by one of our boots. Our bedsheets were not changed over the course of our stay, as that scuff mark was present every afternoon we returned to the hotel room. At the start of our second day, I discovered I had been bitten several times by an insect. I put this down to bad luck and applied some ointment. The following morning, I began to suspect that the bed might have bugs as I had several new bites. I said this to my girlfriend, but she did not think bedbugs were the answer, and as we had only one night remaining, we did not request to be moved. Later, however, she was coming out of the shower and saw a mouse, which we subsequently heard scuttling about during the night. The next morning, I had several new bites, and my girlfriend too had been bitten several times. Fearing food-poisoning, we had skipped the breakfasts every morning which were included in our booking, and on the final morning, we checked out earlier than we have from any other hotel. I have never written a review of a hotel before, but this place was so unbelievably bad that I felt I had to submit something. Do not stay here, even if it is the only place available in your price range. Reschedule your flights, get a holiday loan to afford a better hotel. Do anything but don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Basic”
Reviews.Author: TimmoSouthampton
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted somewhere cheap and clean to sleep whilst in The Netherlands for a week. The Barbacan provided us with that. It is situated a few minutes away from the Zoo and trams stopped near by. It was quite a long walk to the main attractions though so unless you are super fit or crazy, I wouldn't walk to places like Dam Square or the train station. Getting a tram is recommended. Just around the corner was a bakery which smelt delightful every morning. I regret not buying anything in there because it smelt wonderful and i'm sure it would have tasted just as good, judging by the huge queue outside! The hotel was down a small alley way (Our taxi driver didn't even know the hotel existed! - after several calls to people, he finally found it!) and the hotel certainly wasn't a looker! When we got there, check in was quick and easy and the man behind reception spoke English very well. He told us our rooms, gave us a key and off we went to our rooms. The stairs were quite steep (as expected in Amsterdam) and our room was very small and very basic. We shared a twin room but there wasn't much room for anything else except the beds and a TV on the wall. The beds were uncomfortable and squeaked a lot with the slightest bit of movement which was very annoying. The beds were basically fold out beds and were quite low to the floor and after a few days of walking non-stop in Amsterdam, they were the last kind of beds you'd want to go back to! The bathroom and toilet was shared and was kept reasonably clean but I don't think they were cleaned as often as I would have liked. Overall I wouldn't stay here again. There are better places around for less than the price we paid and in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: janina_b83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 6 person room For 2 nights. It was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. It was also very quiet at night. We had a private bathroom with shower but it was so small you could hardly move, But thats the only complaint I have. The stairs going up to the rooms are very nerrow and steep, So I dont reccomend this place to anyone who may have a hard time with them. Breakfast is very good, and will give you a good boost to your day. There is a tram stop close by to get you to where ever you want to go. I would definately stay here again, it was a wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Speedy1983
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is very nice. You get everything what you need for a very low price. The rooms are not very big, but it's enough to sleep and taking a shower ;) - most of the time you have to do other things in amsterdam... You can take a 2min walk to the great zoo of amsterdam. And with the Line 9 you can travel directly from the Central Station to the Hotel (Plantage Kerklaan). We were 4 persons from Austria an spent 3 nights in this hotel. The breakfast was perfect and the people of the hotel very friendly and helpful. Also the rooms were clean. Book this hotel... it's enough, why pay more for some days of joy ;) greetings, Speedy from Austria / Vorarlberg / Bludenz

Reviews.Title: “Good price, quite location, clean but no frills”
Reviews.Author: trippy510
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at this hotel in September. Price was our primary object but based on other reviews we were a little worried about this hotel. It is located near the zoo and is no more than a 20 minute walk to any of the tourist areas. The area is a very quiet residental area and it would probably be too far outside the bar scene for the young crowd that wants to party all night. During the day there was construction going on at the parking garage across the street. There quite a few reasonable priced restaurants moments from the hotel and the pizza place right on the corner is excellent for people watching. The rooms are very small but clean (It reminded me very much of my son's dorm room at college). The stairway is typical dutch, narrow and steep, breakfast a little on the "dry" side with bread, one egg, 2 slices of cold cuts, 2 slices of cheese, tea or coffee (juice extra) per person but internet access is high speed and cheap, staff is excellent. For the price I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Awful”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: The main problem was that the building opposite had major building work going on so we were woken at 8am by a lot of building noise. Obviously when you are on holiday you don't want to get up so early every day! We thought this hotel looked ok on the website and it was a little more expensive than we normally pay when we go to Amsterdam. When we got there, we were disappointed, the room was small and there was only one, thin, flat pillow per person. It was quite far out from the centre. The staff were friendly, and the breakfast was ok, but if you want an orange juice you have to pay. There are definately better budget hotels in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Ferry-feeling”
Reviews.Author: GunnarL
Reviews.Content: Basicly, this was the most lousy hotel I've stayed at (though I guess I deserved it since I only went for the lowest price). The room was the style of a cabin and quite small. It was quite dirty and really hot (no air-condition, just a small window). I didn't use the shower (shared) as it made me think of the toilet in "Trainspotter". They seemed to try to get their money by charging for anything they could.

Reviews.Title: “A total dump!”
Reviews.Author: Oreocookie
Reviews.Content: Beware that none of the pictures posted on Hotels(--), the hotel's individual website etc. are actually of the hotel. The hotel is tired, dirty, and across the street from a crumbling and deserted parking garage. We arrived and could tell before we walked in (the lobby reeks of smoke) that this was not going be a nice place. We checked in with the guy behind the desk and his hands were absolutley filthy...like he had just changed the oil in a car. We asked to see the room before proceeding and he informed us that we had prepaid so we could see the room, but we had already paid for it. I asked if there was an elevator and he laughed. We went up to the room, passing signs saying drugs were not allowed in the hotel. The room was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen and it was beyond tired. The carpet was gross, I wouldn't walk around without shoes on. The bathroom was about the size of an airplane bathroom if they had a shower. It had a dinky light and you could barely see anything. That was probably good because I don't think it was very clean. The bed was uncomfortable and had an old ratty bedspread that could have used a wash. There was a tiny TV without a remote which was annoying. The room did have a safe, but you had to pay $20 to use it! That night there was a group of guys staying in hotel who were partying until 3 a.m. The walls are paper thin so I called the front desk 3 x's during the night and all the front desk guy would do was ask them very politely if they could keep it down. Breakfast is served right off the lobby, and the breakfast room reeks of smoke as well. They just give you some bread, an egg, salami, and cheese. Orange juice is $1 extra which I thought was strange. Our reservation was for 4 nights but we fled after the first night because it was so bad. We knew would really dread coming back to the hotel each night and that's not a way to spend your vacation. We also weren't comfortable leaving our bags in the room while we were out during the day. When we told the hotel we were leaving early they were pretty rude about it and told us if we wanted our $ back to take it up with Hotels(--) (we booked through Hotels(--)). We left with no where to go, but we were so relieved to be out of there that we didn't care. We ended up finding a room at a Best Western nearby and that salvaged our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff makes this hotel worth staying at.”
Reviews.Author: 75YEAROLDTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed in separate rooms at this modest hotel for three nights on December 9, 10, and 11, 2005. When we walked in they somehow had our reservation in hand before we even reached the front desk. The hotel, though modest, was clean, with bright rooms, and comfortable beds. It is located next to the University of Amsterdam and is only a short block and a half away from a No. 9 Tram stop. It is in a very nice section of town. The thing that makes a stay at this hotel most pleasant, however, is the high quality of the staff, most of whom except for the owner is young and possibly are college students. These are all nice people who made our stay exceptional. It's a great place to stay, and, everyone speaks excellent English; a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Booking canceled!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made booking using credit card via internet but when we arrived we were told that there wasn't any booked rooms for us... even though we had printed confirmation of the reservation! They blamed the credit card, saying that probably there was some "technical problem". Anyway they didn't help us at all! Since we arrived in a very crowded weekend in Amsterdam we risked to not find any accomodation for the night for the bad behaviour of the Hotel Barbacan customers! We strongly suggest to find a different (and more reliable) accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, good location. Briliant place, cost saver.”
Reviews.Author: UltimateRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Given some of the comments here I was not sure what to expect. But, it is a great place. Feature number 1: it is very quiet, so a good sleep, given the good beds, is more or less secured, even though this is very close to the centre of Amsterdam. Other features: location is very close to the University of Amsterdam. Good cafe close by is at the Kriterion (wireless lan access, across the street of UvA). Internet access, good breakfast, clean shower/bathroom, fair price. This hotel saves you money, the price is right and everything you need is at the hotel or very close by. Last but not least: the breakfast service is obesity conscious; however, the waiter more than compensates for the apparent lack of carbs at Barbacan. No mis-understanding: the breakfast is sufficient and balanced.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Barbacan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annettecuthbertson
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed at the Hotel and would definately return. It is near the Artis Zoo and within walking distance of all the main attractions. We stayed in 2 rooms with 2 double beds and Shower/Toilet inside room (Rooms 25 and 17 for info) and were relieved to find the room was clean and bright but basic. Sheets were freshly laundered and were changed on our second night. Shower wasnt great but did the job. There was internet access in the foyer, and Cigs and Pop vending machine also. Breakfast was served up to 9.30am and consisted of Boiled Egg, mixed Meat, cheese and various breads. Apple/Orange juice was 1 euro extra. Service prompt and friendly. 24hr access to rooms and supplied with additional room keys if required for group. Lad on reception at night was lovely with us despite us trooping in drunk in the early hours! He also made cup of Tea for my friend when she was feeling unwell with too much sun. All staff were lovely and i would recommend this Hotel if you are looking for a cheap and cheerful trip.

Reviews.Title: “basic, clean, perfect for this price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a very tiny price (we paid a double 10 euros more than we would have paid two beds in a large 20-beds dormitory in a hostel), with basic but good breakfast, clean rooms, and in quiet district near the center, it's a good place for small budget. The place wasn't crowded (end of january 2005), and I think the acoustic between the rooms is the week part when there are lots of people, but really, for this price it's really OK. Even if there is no bathroom on each floor, as expected (no bathroom on the third one). If you expect small rooms, Ikea style furniture and basic comfort, you'll be satisfied. If you want the Ritz, you definitely should change your budget for Amsterdam... ...Oh, by the way, they rent bicycles in the hotel, which is nice as well. Don't forget your cash... if you pay with a credit card they charge you an extra amount (transaction fee). Better to have a drink somewhere instead. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good, if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: C_from_DC
Reviews.Content: My finance and I were on a very tight budget but we got a good package deal off the internet so we decided to stay here. In sum, I would recommend it but know what to expect, or else you will be disappointed. This place is very plain and spartan, offering the bare essentials (bed, closet and cable tv). At first I was turned off by the location, it's not in the thicket of all the action, but it was only a 10-15 minute walk from it all, and a lovely walk at that along canals. Also, I was hesitant about sharing a bathroom with the floor, but it wasn't that bad. If you plan on doing this (we did it because it's very cheap this way), know that it's not going to be the nicest bathroom and that you should take flip-flops. It was clean, but being an American I know we tend to get a little squeemish about cleanliness sometimes. It's fine. Just think of it as a college dorm with shared bathrooms. Breakfast was included and it was a fine continental fare - toast (different breads), jam, butter, hard boiled egg and slices of ham and cheese, with awesome coffee. The lady at the front desk, Nelly, is also very helpful and nice. In all, stay here if you're young, on a tight budget and don't really care too much about accommodations. For us, the most important thing was staying in a clean, safe place near all the action that was cheap - and that's what we got here.

HotelInfo.Name: Barbacan Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Plantage Muidergracht 89, Amsterdam 1018 TN, The Netherlands
